intro: Meniscium chrysodioides, commonly known as the golden starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, giving it a delicate and star-like appearance. Its leaves are typically narrow and finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Meniscium chrysodioides is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
